intro: Setachna cyanus, commonly known as the cornflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its striking blue or violet petals and yellow centers, which make it a popular garden plant. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are upright and branching. Setachna cyanus is often used in traditional medicine and as a source of natural dyes.
